content.question: In a population of bats living in a certain region, 30 percent have a wingspan greater than 10 inches. In a random sample of 80 bats living outside of the region, 20 had a wingspan greater than 10 inches. Consider a one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test to investigate whether there is evidence that the proportion of bats with a wingspan greater than 10 inches living outside the region is different from that of the bats living in the region. Which of the following is the correct test statistic?

choices.label: <math alttext="z equals the fraction 0.30 minus 0.25 over the square root of the fraction 0.25 times 0.75 over 80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.30</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.25</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.75</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="z equals the fraction 0.30 minus 0.25 over the square root of the fraction 0.30 times 0.70 over 80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.30</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.30</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>0.70</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="z equals the fraction 0.20 minus 0.30 over the square root of the fraction 0.30 times 0.70 over 80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.30</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.30</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.70</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="z equals the fraction 0.25 minus 0.30 over the square root of the fraction 0.25 times 0.75 over 80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.30</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.25</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.75</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="z equals the fraction 0.25 minus 0.30 over the square root of the fraction 0.30 times 0.70 over 80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.30</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.30</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>0.70</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="z equals the fraction 0.25 minus 0.30 over the square root of the fraction 0.30 times 0.70 over 80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.30</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.30</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>0.70</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
